content: bethknitsallday bethknitsallday garter rib hat © beth koskie december 2014 the garter rib provides a nice contrast to the 1x1 ribbed band and adds texture to create a warm hat the fit is comfortable and stretchy to fit a wide range of head sizes knit in doble-stranded worsted or bulky yarn the pattern knits up quickly and is a great stash buster if using double- stranded worsted you can combine different yarns for a fun and colorful effect sizes child teen/woman adult man materials worsted weight yarn double stranded malabrigo patons cascade 220 galway knit picks wool of the andes etc a 100 gr skein approx 210 yds is enough for all sizes or bulky brown sheep bulky etc 125 yds for all sizes directions size 10 5 circulars you will need 2nd circular or dpn s in cast on 56 60 64 sts place marker and join being careful the same size for decreases not to twist the stitches yarn needle for darning ends work 8 rounds of k1 p1 ribbing stitch marker knit 1 round then work garter rib pattern rounds garter rib pattern rounds round 1 k2 p2 around round 2 knit around work these 2 pattern rounds until you have 12 13 14 garter ridges after the ribbing then work 5 rounds of decreases decreases use second circular or dpn s as needed round 1 *k2tog p2tog repeat from * around 28 30 32 sts round 2 knit around round 3 repeat round 1 14 15 16 sts round 4 knit around round 5 repeat round 1 7 8 8 sts cut yarn long enough to weave through remaining sts and pull tight end off and weave in ends
